lead_paragraph: Conservationists had long believed that the zoo, run by Buddhist monks, was a front for illegal trafficking in tiger parts.

headline.print_headline: Last of Temple’s 137 Tigers Is Seized, Ending Tourist Draw
headline.main: Tiger Sanctuary in Thailand Closes Amid Accusations of Wildlife Trafficking

snippet: Conservationists had long believed that the zoo, run by Buddhist monks, was a front for illegal trafficking in tiger parts.
abstract: Week-long operation initiated by Wildlife Conservation Office comes to end as final tiger, out of 137 previously held at Tiger Temple in Thailand, is removed from Buddhist-themed zoo headed by abbot Luangta Chan; investigators found conclusive evidence that suggests so-called tiger sanctuary actually dealt in illegal trafficking of tiger parts, with animals having been acquired through poachers.
